item.title: 500 Million Straws
item.description:
In the last few years, it’s been quite common to see the statement that “Americans throw away 500 million straws per day” thrown around. That figure seems to not having any verifiable backing and either way I agree that one time use plastic items should go away. But that’s not why I’m here. I’m here because I want to visualize what 500 million straws per day is.

EcoCycle already tried to do this by comparing it to the capacity of school buses but that’s just boring. I’d rather use speed… specifically, if one single machine had to make all 500 million straws, per day, how fast would they come out of that machine?
